column4: can anyone tell me how I can install the previous version of my Nvidia Drivers? I cannot see them in the Package Manager.
I have, but those drivers are weird... they are asking me to compile some kernel or something, and I'm still noobish, and affraid to kill my system
yes it may :). why do you need those older drivers?
I need the old ones to fix a font problem I'm having with Guild-Wars in cedega
that MAY be cedega's fault are you absolutely sure its the nvidia?
I've been on all the forums and tried everything, on the one forum the guys were saying that the font problem is only with nvidia drivers 8xxx and that I need to install 7xxx
so firs install kernel headers and dl nvidia drivers.
THEN press ctrl-alt-f1 and login. then "sudo rm /tmp/.X0-lock" then "bash nvidia-driver....run"
ok, I seem to have the headers install allready
cool. read what i said before then try to do it. :)
shall i write them down again?
i hope it wont make you X crash. if so then in /etc/X11/xorg.conf, reset your driver from "nvidia" to "nv"
. yeah, I figured that :P .... that much at least I know
okok, sry, just in case you didnt know :)
